content:
WorkflowMarkupSerializationManager Class

Definition

Manages design-time serialization to and from extensible Application Markup Language (XAML) for workflows.

In this Article

public class WorkflowMarkupSerializationManager : IServiceProvider, System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.IDesignerSerializationManager
Inheritance
System.Object
WorkflowMarkupSerializationManager

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
Equals(Object,Object)
GetHashCode()
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
ToString()

Remarks

Note

This material discusses types and namespaces that are obsolete. For more information, see Deprecated Types in Windows Workflow Foundation 4.5.

A workflow or activity designer can use WorkflowMarkupSerializationManager to access services useful to managing design-time serialization processes. For example, WorkflowMarkupSerializationManager can be used to create objects, look up types, identify objects, and customize the serialization of particular types.

Constructors

WorkflowMarkupSerializationManager(IDesignerSerializationManager)

Initializes a new instance of the WorkflowMarkupSerializationManager class by using the specified IDesignerSerializationManager.

public WorkflowMarkupSerializationManager (System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.IDesignerSerializationManager manager);
manager
IDesignerSerializationManager

The IDesignerSerializationManager with which to initialize the WorkflowMarkupSerializationManager.

Properties

Context

Gets a stack-based, user-defined storage area that is useful for communication between serializers.

public System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.ContextStack Context { get; }
Value
ContextStack

A ContextStack that contains information about the current object being serialized.

Remarks

Some serializers require information about the context of an object to correctly persist their state. Context enables a serializer to set data about the context of an object that it is serializing to a ContextStack where another serializer can access it.

LocalAssembly

Gets or sets the assembly that is associated with the current serializer.

public System.Reflection.Assembly LocalAssembly { get; set; }
Value
Assembly

The Assembly that is associated with the current serializer.

SerializationManager

Gets or sets the serialization manager to use with the current serializer.

protected System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.IDesignerSerializationManager SerializationManager { get; set; }
Value
IDesignerSerializationManager

The IDesignerSerializationManager to use with the current serializer.

Methods

AddSerializationProvider(IDesignerSerializationProvider)

Adds the specified serialization provider to the serialization manager.

public void AddSerializationProvider (System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.IDesignerSerializationProvider provider);
provider
IDesignerSerializationProvider

The IDesignerSerializationProvider to add.

Remarks

AddSerializationProvider adds a custom serialization provider to the serialization manager. Serialization providers can provide custom serializers for a particular type of object or set of types of objects. During serialization, each custom serialization provider is queried to return a serializer for a specific data type, if it can provide one. The serialization manager uses the custom serializer provided by this method before using the default serializer for a particular type.

GetSerializer(Type,Type)

Returns a serializer of the specified type for an object of the specified type.

public object GetSerializer (Type objectType, Type serializerType);
objectType
Type

The Type for which to retrieve the serializer.

serializerType
Type

The Type of the serializer to retrieve.

Returns
System.Object

The requested serializer, or a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) if no appropriate serializer can be located.

GetService(Type)

Returns a service object of the specified type.

public object GetService (Type serviceType);
serviceType
Type

The Type of service object to return.

Returns
System.Object

A service object of type serviceType, or a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) if there is no service object of type serviceType.

GetType(String)

Returns a type of the specified name.

public virtual Type GetType (string typeName);
typeName
String

The fully-qualified name of the Type to load.

Returns
Type

The Type associated with typeName.

GetType(XmlQualifiedName)

Returns that type associated with the specified XML qualified name.

public virtual Type GetType (System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName xmlQualifiedName);
xmlQualifiedName
XmlQualifiedName

The XmlQualifiedName of the type to load.

Returns
Type

The Type associated with xmlQualifiedName.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

xmlQualifiedName contains a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

Remarks

An XML qualified name is a namespace-qualified local name, in the format of namespace:localname.

Because prefixes are only required when XML is persisted or read, they are irrelevant for XmlQualifiedName objects. It is the responsibility of the user to ensure the local name does not contain a ":"

GetXmlQualifiedName(Type,String)

Returns the XML-qualified name associated with the specified type.

public virtual System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName GetXmlQualifiedName (Type type, out string prefix);
type
Type

The Type for which to return the XML-qualified name.

prefix
String

When this method returns, contains the XML prefix for the qualified name or an empty string if no prefix is defined. This parameter is passed uninitialized.

Returns
XmlQualifiedName

The XmlQualifiedName associated with type.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

type contains a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

RemoveSerializationProvider(IDesignerSerializationProvider)

Removes a custom serialization provider from the WorkflowMarkupSerializationManager.

public void RemoveSerializationProvider (System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.IDesignerSerializationProvider provider);
provider
IDesignerSerializationProvider

The IDesignerSerializationProvider to remove. This provider must be added using stem.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializationManager.AddSerializationProvider*.

ReportError(Object)

Reports an error in serialization.

public void ReportError (object errorInformation);
errorInformation
System.Object

The error to report.

Remarks

errorInformation can be of any object type. If it is an exception, the message of the exception is extracted and reported to the user. If it is any other type, ToString is called to display the information to the user.

Explicit Interface Implementations

IDesignerSerializationManager.CreateInstance(Type,ICollection,String,Boolean)

Creates an instance of the specified type and adds it to a collection of named instances.

object IDesignerSerializationManager.CreateInstance (Type type, System.Collections.ICollection arguments, string name, bool addToContainer);
type
Type

The Type to create.

arguments
ICollection

An ICollection that contains the arguments for type.

name
String

The name of the object. This name can be used to access the object later using stem.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializationManager.System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.IDesignerSerializationManager.GetInstance*. If a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) is passed, the object is still created but cannot be accessed by name.

addToContainer
Boolean

true to add the object to the design container; otherwise, false.

Returns
System.Object

The newly created object.

Remarks

If addToContainer is set to true, the object must implement IComponent for this to have any effect.

IDesignerSerializationManager.GetInstance(String)

Returns an instance of a created object of the specified name.

object IDesignerSerializationManager.GetInstance (string name);
name
String

The name of the object to retrieve.

Returns
System.Object

An instance of the object with the given name, or a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) if no object by that name can be found.

Remarks

name must be set through a prior call to <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializationManager.System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.IDesignerSerializationManager.CreateInstance%2A>.

IDesignerSerializationManager.GetName(Object)

Returns the name of the specified object.

string IDesignerSerializationManager.GetName (object value);
value
System.Object

The Object for which to retrieve the name.

Returns
String

The name of the object, or a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) if the object is unnamed.

IDesignerSerializationManager.Properties

Gets a collection of properties that can be serialized with available serializers.

System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptorCollection System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.IDesignerSerializationManager.Properties { get; }
Returns
PropertyDescriptorCollection

A PropertyDescriptorCollection that contains the properties to serialize.

Remarks

This property can contain an empty collection. A serializer should never assume that any properties exist.

IDesignerSerializationManager.SetName(Object,String)

Sets the name of the specified existing object.

void IDesignerSerializationManager.SetName (object instance, string name);
instance
System.Object

The object to name.

name
String

The name to assign to the object.

Remarks

<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializationManager.System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.IDesignerSerializationManager.SetName%2A> is useful when you need to create and then name an instance of an object without using <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializationManager.System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.IDesignerSerializationManager.CreateInstance%2A>.
